content.question: Scholars believe that the tunnels in the architectural complex at Chavín de Huántar were intended to create an otherworldly environment by manipulating space and light; more recent excavations have revealed that the tunnels may also have

choices.label: led to underground tombs filled with luxury goods
been strategically placed to create a distinct auditory experience
served as passageways between public spaces and living quarters
been aligned to symbolize the movement of certain astronomical bodies

content.answer: been strategically placed to create a distinct auditory experience

topic.text: 5.4: Theories and Interpretations of Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 7.B: Explain how one or more art historically valid interpretations of a work of art (or group of related works of art) are derived from an analysis of its form, style, materials, content, function, context, reception, and/or meaning.
